item.title: Kelly add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The highest function of love is that it makes the loved one a unique and irreplaceable being." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Morning without you is a dwindled dawn." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres." -- Anonymous

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "Love has nothing to do with what you are expecting to get - only with what you are expecting to give - which is everything" -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ginnetta Correli
item.description: "Children and dogs are the messengers of God some of us do not deserve them" -- Ginnetta Correli

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by John Churton Collins
item.description: "In prosperity our friends know us; in adversity we know our friends." -- John Churton Collins

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "What we once enjoyed and deeply loved we can never lose, For all that we love deeply becomes a part of us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
